title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco and Brandon Baez received prison sentences for mail theft and check fraud in Massachusetts.
Rios-Franco received 35 months in prison plus supervised release and must pay $12,528 in restitution.
The defendants stole checks from USPS boxes, altered them, and deposited into accounts from June 2023 to February 2024.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Marcelo Gomes da Silva, a Milford teen, detained by ICE in 2025, was invited to the State of the Union.
Rep. Seth Moulton invited Gomes to highlight issues in the immigration system during President Trump's address.
Gomes' arrest led to community protests; he faced poor conditions during his six-day detention in Burlington.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a center-ice goal in the U.S. win over Denmark at the Olympics but laughed off the mishap.
Swayman attributed the goal to losing sight of the puck amid a 'flash screen,' not issues with the rink's black boards.
Despite allowing two goals, Swayman helped Team USA to victory, registering 18 stops with potential Olympic lineup changes ahead.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum's potential return from Achilles injury could impact Celtics' playoff push, with the team second in the East.
NBA stars Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony discuss Tatum's anticipated return, highlighting his All-Star caliber play.
Tatum has increased practice reps, including with the Celtics' G League affiliate, indicating progress in his rehabilitation.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million cap space, targeting key free agents to address roster needs.
Colts WR Alec Pierce, Packers OT Rasheed Walker among potential targets for Patriots in free agency.
Ravens TE Isaiah Likely and Eagles EDGE Jaelan Phillips also considered for potential roster improvements.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN and MLB.TV have partnered to make ESPN the streaming home for MLB games.
ESPN Unlimited subscribers can add MLB.TV for $134.99 per season; a non-subscriber pays $149.99 including a free ESPN month.
New MLB.TV subscribers must register via ESPN app; ESPN Unlimited not required post free month, but encouraged.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics' Jayson Tatum participated in a practice with the Maine Celtics after recovering from an Achilles tear.
Ron Harper Jr. stated Tatum looked strong in practice, but his return to the Celtics this season remains uncertain.
Tatum is practicing with the G League and participating in scrimmages, fueling speculation about a potential return.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the U.S. in WalletHub's 2026 report.
Massachusetts leads with over 47% of adults holding a bachelor's degree and nearly 22% with advanced degrees.
Following Massachusetts, Vermont and Maryland placed second and third, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia ranked lowest.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare T206 Honus Wagner baseball card, with ties to Massachusetts, is up for auction, closing on February 21.
The T206 Wagner card was first obtained by Morton Bernstein in the early 1900s from a Sweet Caporal Cigarette pack.
Auction is part of Ken Goldin's collectibles show; the current bid with buyer's premium stands at $4,758,000.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will start as goalie for Team USA against Denmark in the 2026 Winter Olympics.
Swayman helped Team USA win the 2025 IIHF World Championship, with a 5-0 record and a shutout.
Bruins teammate Charlie McAvoy will also play, joining Swayman for Team USA in Saturday's game.
